columns.name: service_name
columns.description: The name of the service.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the service.

columns.name: status
columns.description: The status of the service. Valid values are: ACTIVE, DRAINING, or INACTIVE.

columns.name: cluster_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster that hosts the service.

columns.name: task_definition
columns.description: The task definition to use for tasks in the service.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: The date and time when the service was created.

columns.name: created_by
columns.description: The principal that created the service.

columns.name: deployment_controller_type
columns.description: The deployment controller type to use. Possible values are: ECS, CODE_DEPLOY, and EXTERNAL.

columns.name: desired_count
columns.description: The desired number of instantiations of the task definition to keep running on the service.

columns.name: enable_ecs_managed_tags
columns.description: Specifies whether to enable Amazon ECS managed tags for the tasks in the service.

columns.name: enable_execute_command
columns.description: Indicates whether or not the execute command functionality is enabled for the service.

columns.name: health_check_grace_period_seconds
columns.description: The period of time, in seconds, that the Amazon ECS service scheduler ignores unhealthy Elastic Load Balancing target health checks after a task has first started.

columns.name: launch_type
columns.description: The launch type on which your service is running. If no value is specified, it will default to EC2.

columns.name: pending_count
columns.description: The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the PENDING state.

columns.name: platform_family
columns.description: The operating system that your tasks in the service run on.

columns.name: platform_version
columns.description: The platform version on which to run your service.

columns.name: propagate_tags
columns.description: Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition or the service to the task. If no value is specified, the tags are not propagated.

columns.name: role_arn
columns.description: The ARN of the IAM role associated with the service that allows the Amazon ECS container agent to register container instances with an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer.

columns.name: running_count
columns.description: The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the RUNNING state.

columns.name: scheduling_strategy
columns.description: The scheduling strategy to use for the service.

columns.name: capacity_provider_strategy
columns.description: The capacity provider strategy associated with the service.

columns.name: deployment_configuration
columns.description: Optional deployment parameters that control how many tasks run during the deployment and the ordering of stopping and starting tasks.

columns.name: deployments
columns.description: The current state of deployments for the service.

columns.name: events
columns.description: The event stream for your service. A maximum of 100 of the latest events are displayed.

columns.name: load_balancers
columns.description: A list of Elastic Load Balancing load balancer objects, containing the load balancer name, the container name (as it appears in a container definition), and the container port to access from the load balancer.

columns.name: network_configuration
columns.description: The VPC subnet and security group configuration for tasks that receive their own elastic network interface by using the awsvpc networking mode.

columns.name: placement_constraints
columns.description: The placement constraints for the tasks in the service.

columns.name: placement_strategy
columns.description: The placement strategy that determines how tasks for the service are placed.

columns.name: service_registries
columns.description: The details of the service discovery registries to assign to this service.

columns.name: task_sets
columns.description: Information about a set of Amazon ECS tasks in either an AWS CodeDeploy or an EXTERNAL deployment.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: The metadata that you apply to the service to help you categorize and organize them.
